description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

The Google Cloud Learning team is responsible for Google Cloud training and certification offerings. The trainings are delivered through a mix of internal trainers, external training partners, including on-demand training partners and hands-on labs platform. Certifications are either Professional level or Associate and are offered across job roles such as Security Engineer, Data Engineer or a Cloud Engineer.

Our team is responsible for identifying, developing, launching and successfully managing the scaled learning programs and partnerships that drive impact at scale. Our reach includes Google Cloud prospects, customers, partners, and students who want to learn more about Google Cloud.

You'll use your analytical skills to understand the Certification market needs, identify audience patterns across certifications and to track the success of anything launched. You'll be responsible for creating and managing the playbook for how to successfully land new Certifications in identified markets globally.

You'll use your global perspective, as many of our Certification offerings are available in multiple languages, and a critical part of your role will be working within non-English speaking markets. You'll understand and manage the different approaches that are required when engaging with our three key audiences for Certifications, including Google Cloud Customers (B2B), Individual developers (B2C) and Partners.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of program management experience.
  • 5 years of experience delivering projects with stakeholders (both internal and external) within deadlines.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with a large enterprise in a sales operations or program management role.
  • Experience working in a global team, with different cultures and navigating multiple time zones.
  • Understanding of certification programs.
  • Proven ability in implementing structure and process into new initiatives, departments or projects.
  • Demonstrated ability and comfort in using data and analytics to drive business decision making.
  • Self-starter, with the ability to work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment.
responsibilities:
• Design and drive new programs and initiatives to increase the number of people with Google Cloud Certifications globally.
  • Work cross-functionally and globally to identify, design and land Certification programs across our target audiences.
  • Manage all operational aspects of programs developed (e.g., clear workflows, processes, tools, etc.) and ensure that programs can be delivered in a scalable, globally consistent manner in the identified languages and locations as well as be delivered on-time and within budget.
  • Track program success and iterate based on observations and analysis.
title: Global Certifications Lead, Google Cloud
